back_cards.definition_en: To make something larger in amount or number.
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to increase her savings for a new car.

back_cards.definition_en: To grow or rise in value or level.
back_cards.example_en: The company plans to increase its profits by 10% this year.

back_cards.definition_en: To enhance or improve in quality.
back_cards.example_en: Regular practice will increase your skills in playing the piano.

back_cards.definition_en: To expand in scope or size.
back_cards.example_en: The forest fire caused officials to increase the evacuation zone.

back_cards.definition_en: To boost in frequency or occurrence.
back_cards.example_en: They decided to increase the number of weekly team meetings.

back_cards.definition_en: To do something or take action.
back_cards.example_en: He acted quickly to help his friend in need.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform in a play or movie.
back_cards.example_en: She loves to act in the community theater's annual show.

back_cards.definition_en: To behave in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: You should act politely at the formal dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To function or serve a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: This button acts as a switch to turn on the machine.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a decision or have an effect.
back_cards.example_en: The new law will act to protect endangered species.

back_cards.definition_en: The direction toward the North Pole.
back_cards.example_en: The hikers headed north to reach the mountain summit.

back_cards.definition_en: A region or area in the northern part.
back_cards.example_en: The north of the country is known for its cold winters.

back_cards.definition_en: A geographical orientation on a map.
back_cards.example_en: The map shows the river flowing from the north.
The north has more factories than the southern areas.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of reference in navigation.
back_cards.example_en: The compass always points north during our hikes.

back_cards.definition_en: In a good or satisfactory way.
back_cards.example_en: She sings well and always gets applause.
He studied the topic well before the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: In a healthy or sound manner.
back_cards.example_en: After the surgery, she recovered well.

back_cards.definition_en: To a considerable extent or degree.
back_cards.example_en: The project is well underway and almost finished.

back_cards.definition_en: In a kind or approving manner.
back_cards.example_en: Her boss spoke well of her work ethic.

back_cards.definition_en: The red liquid in the body that carries oxygen.
back_cards.example_en: The nurse took a sample of his blood for testing.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of life or vitality.
back_cards.example_en: The story describes the blood pulsing through the hero’s veins.
They are related by blood, being cousins.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for violence or sacrifice.
back_cards.example_en: The battle was fierce, with much blood spilled.

back_cards.definition_en: A component in medical or scientific study.
back_cards.example_en: The lab analyzed the blood for signs of infection.

back_cards.definition_en: The beliefs and customs of a group.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrates the rich culture of the region.
She studied the culture of ancient Rome in school.
The company promotes a culture of teamwork.

back_cards.definition_en: A shared way of life in a community.
back_cards.example_en: The island’s culture includes unique dances and music.

back_cards.definition_en: The growth of microorganisms in a lab.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist examined the bacterial culture under a microscope.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the practice of medicine.
back_cards.example_en: She pursued a medical career to become a doctor.
The hospital provides medical care for all patients.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to drugs or equipment for health.
back_cards.example_en: The pharmacy sells medical supplies like bandages.
The medical research focused on curing diabetes.
The medical team arrived quickly at the accident scene.
The food was ok, but not amazing.
After the fall, he said he was ok.
Is it ok if I borrow your book?
The computer is ok now after the repair.
This small tent is ok for a short camping trip.

back_cards.definition_en: All people in a group or place.
back_cards.example_en: Everybody at the party enjoyed the music.
Everybody in the town knows about the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: All members of a team or organization.
back_cards.example_en: Everybody in the office worked late to meet the deadline.
Everybody clapped when the speaker finished.

back_cards.definition_en: All people in a general sense.
back_cards.example_en: Everybody needs clean water to survive.
The flag was placed at the top of the hill.
She finished at the top of her class.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of clothing for the upper body.
back_cards.example_en: He wore a red top with jeans.

back_cards.definition_en: The lid or cover of something.
back_cards.example_en: She opened the top of the jar carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: The peak of a hierarchy or ranking.
back_cards.example_en: The CEO is at the top of the company.
The math test was very difficult for the students.
Fixing the old car was a difficult task.
Climbing the steep mountain was difficult but rewarding.

back_cards.definition_en: Not easy to please or deal with.
back_cards.example_en: The difficult customer complained about everything.
They faced a difficult decision about moving abroad.
Please close the door to keep the room warm.
The store will close early on holidays.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring something to a finish.
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to close the deal with the client.

back_cards.definition_en: To reduce a gap or distance.
back_cards.example_en: The runner tried to close the gap with the leader.
They had to close the road due to flooding.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of communication using words.
back_cards.example_en: She is learning a new language to travel abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: The style of speech or writing.
back_cards.example_en: The poet’s language was beautiful and vivid.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study about communication.
back_cards.example_en: He majored in English in college.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of terms used in a profession.
back_cards.example_en: Medical language can be hard to understand.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of expressing ideas or feelings.
back_cards.example_en: Music is a universal language of emotion.

back_cards.definition_en: An opening in a wall for light or air.
back_cards.example_en: She opened the window to let in fresh air.

back_cards.definition_en: A transparent panel in a vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: The car window was foggy in the cold morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A time period for doing something.
back_cards.example_en: We have a short window to finish the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A display area in a store.
back_cards.example_en: The shop’s window showed the latest fashion.

back_cards.definition_en: A section on a computer screen.
back_cards.example_en: He opened a new window on his browser.

back_cards.definition_en: An answer or reply to something.
back_cards.example_en: She gave a quick response to the question.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction to an event or stimulus.
back_cards.example_en: His response to the news was one of shock.
The company issued a response to the complaint.
The fire department’s response was immediate.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a ceremony or ritual.
back_cards.example_en: The congregation gave a response during the service.

back_cards.definition_en: The total number of people in an area.
back_cards.example_en: The city’s population grew rapidly last year.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of organisms of one species.
back_cards.example_en: The deer population in the forest is thriving.

back_cards.definition_en: The inhabitants of a specific region.
back_cards.example_en: The rural population relies on farming.
The study focused on the elderly population.

back_cards.definition_en: A collective group with shared traits.
back_cards.example_en: The student population at the school is diverse.
He chose to lie about his whereabouts last night.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in a horizontal position.
back_cards.example_en: She likes to lie on the grass and watch clouds.
The village lies at the foot of the mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: To remain in a certain state.
back_cards.example_en: The old book lay forgotten on the shelf.
He lied to avoid getting into trouble.

back_cards.definition_en: A tall plant with a trunk and branches.
back_cards.example_en: The oak tree in the yard is over 100 years old.
She drew a family tree for her school project.
The lumber company planted new trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of growth or life.
back_cards.example_en: The tree in the story represented hope.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure in computing or math.
back_cards.example_en: The programmer used a binary tree for the algorithm.
Kids were playing in the park near the lake.
The national park protects endangered animals.
She found a spot in the crowded park.

back_cards.definition_en: A landscaped area around a building.
back_cards.example_en: The office park had beautiful gardens.
The baseball game was held at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who does a job.
back_cards.example_en: The factory worker operates heavy machinery.
The company hired ten new workers this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the working class.
back_cards.example_en: Workers united to demand better wages.
The volunteer worker helped clean the park.

back_cards.definition_en: An insect in a colony with specific roles.
back_cards.example_en: The worker bees gathered nectar for the hive.

back_cards.definition_en: To create a picture or sketch.
back_cards.example_en: She loves to draw landscapes with charcoal.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull or move something closer.
back_cards.example_en: He drew the curtains to let in light.
The new exhibit drew a large crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: To reach a conclusion or inference.
back_cards.example_en: They drew conclusions from the data collected.

back_cards.definition_en: To end a game with equal scores.
back_cards.example_en: The soccer match ended in a draw.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed proposal for doing something.
back_cards.example_en: The team made a plan for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A strategy or course of action.
back_cards.example_en: Her plan was to save money for travel.

back_cards.definition_en: A map or diagram of an area.
back_cards.example_en: The architect showed the house’s floor plan.
His plan is to retire by age 60.
The travel plan included a visit to Paris.

back_cards.definition_en: To fall or let something fall.
back_cards.example_en: She dropped her phone on the floor.
The temperature will drop tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To deliver or leave something off.
back_cards.example_en: He dropped the package at the post office.
They decided to drop the topic.

back_cards.definition_en: To release or let go suddenly.
back_cards.example_en: The pilot dropped supplies to the village.

back_cards.definition_en: To press or move something forward.
back_cards.example_en: She pushed the cart through the store.
The coach pushed the team to work harder.
The company pushed their new product online.
He pushed the heavy door open.
The boss pushed her to meet the deadline.
Earth is the third planet from the sun.
The farmer tilled the earth for planting.
People across the earth celebrated the holiday.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of nature or environment.
back_cards.example_en: She works to protect the earth from pollution.
Explorers mapped the earth centuries ago.
The storm was the cause of the power outage.

back_cards.definition_en: A goal or principle worth supporting.
back_cards.example_en: She volunteers for an environmental cause.
The lawyer took on a high-profile cause.

back_cards.definition_en: The source of an event or action.
back_cards.example_en: Negligence was the cause of the accident.
They joined the cause to promote literacy.
The cost is $10 per person.
She earns $50 per hour at her job.

back_cards.definition_en: According to or as stated by.
back_cards.example_en: Per the instructions, we arrived early.

back_cards.definition_en: In relation to a unit of measure.
back_cards.example_en: The car gets 30 miles per gallon.
The order was placed per the online form.

back_cards.definition_en: Belonging to an individual, not public.
back_cards.example_en: He kept his diary in a private place.
The meeting was private and invitation-only.
She works for a private company.
They had a private conversation in the garden.
The cabin is in a private spot by the lake.
We’re watching a movie tonight.
It might rain tonight, so bring an umbrella.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to plans for this evening.
back_cards.example_en: She’s meeting friends tonight at the café.

back_cards.definition_en: In the context of tonight’s events.
back_cards.example_en: The concert tonight sold out quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: As part of a schedule or deadline.
back_cards.example_en: The report is due tonight before midnight.
She trained hard for the marathon race.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people with shared traits.
back_cards.example_en: The survey asked about race and ethnicity.

back_cards.definition_en: A contest for a goal or position.
back_cards.example_en: The race for mayor was very competitive.
The river’s race swept the boat downstream.

back_cards.definition_en: A pursuit or effort to achieve.
back_cards.example_en: The race to find a cure continues.
She is taller than her brother.

back_cards.definition_en: To introduce the second part of a comparison.
back_cards.example_en: This book is more exciting than the movie.
I’d rather walk than drive in traffic.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate an exception or contrast.
back_cards.example_en: He has no hobbies other than reading.

back_cards.definition_en: To express a limit or extent.
back_cards.example_en: The project took longer than expected.
She received a letter from her friend.
The word starts with the letter B.
He wrote a letter of resignation.
The postman delivered a letter today.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol or mark in writing.
back_cards.example_en: The sign had bold letters for emphasis.
She chose the other book on the shelf.
The other guests left after the party.
He lives on the other side of town.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to another of a set.
back_cards.example_en: One shoe is here, but the other is missing.
Other factors affected the decision.
The police officer carried a gun on duty.
He used a nail gun to build the fence.
The race began when the gun fired.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of violence or power.
back_cards.example_en: The movie featured a dramatic gun scene.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for spraying or shooting.
back_cards.example_en: The painter used a spray gun for the wall.
The recipe was simple to follow.
She wore a simple dress to the event.
The game has simple rules for beginners.
They live a simple life in the countryside.
His simple explanation clarified the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of lessons or studies.
back_cards.example_en: She enrolled in a cooking course.
The river follows a winding course.
The main course was grilled salmon.

back_cards.definition_en: A direction or plan of action.
back_cards.example_en: The project is on course to finish early.

back_cards.definition_en: A playing area for sports like golf.
back_cards.example_en: The golf course was in perfect condition.
I wonder what the weather will be tomorrow.
She wondered at the beauty of the sunset.
He wondered if the plan would work.
They wondered why she left so suddenly.
We wondered at the skill of the dancers.

back_cards.definition_en: To include as a necessary part.
back_cards.example_en: The project will involve teamwork.
She loves to involve herself in charity work.
The recipe involves using fresh herbs.
The decision involves everyone in the group.
Learning a language involves regular practice.

back_cards.definition_en: A place of suffering or torment.
back_cards.example_en: The movie depicted hell as a fiery abyss.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of frustration or anger.
back_cards.example_en: What the hell is going on here?

back_cards.definition_en: A very difficult or bad situation.
back_cards.example_en: The storm was hell for the travelers.

back_cards.definition_en: A place or state of chaos.
back_cards.example_en: The crowded market felt like hell.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis in informal speech.
back_cards.example_en: It was a hell of a good concert.
The poor family struggled to buy food.
The poor lighting made reading difficult.
The poor dog was left out in the rain.
His poor performance led to extra training.
She made a poor choice by missing the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Every one of two or more items.
back_cards.example_en: Each student received a certificate.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to individuals in a group.
back_cards.example_en: Each of the books is worth reading.
They gave each child a gift at the party.
Each team member got a task.
Each option has its own benefits.
His answer to the quiz was correct.
The scientist found an answer to the issue.
Her answer was polite but firm.
Laughter was his answer to the joke.

back_cards.definition_en: A reply to a letter or message.
back_cards.example_en: She wrote an answer to the email.
They went hiking to enjoy nature.
Her kind nature made her popular.

back_cards.definition_en: The physical universe and its laws.
back_cards.example_en: Science studies the laws of nature.

back_cards.definition_en: A type or category of something.
back_cards.example_en: The problem is of a technical nature.

back_cards.definition_en: The essence or character of a thing.
back_cards.example_en: The nature of the job requires patience.
The hospital administration improved patient care.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of governing or leading.
back_cards.example_en: The new administration passed several laws.
The school administration met to discuss policies.
The administration of the exam took hours.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of giving or applying.
back_cards.example_en: The administration of medicine saved lives.
Colds are a common illness in winter.

back_cards.definition_en: Shared by multiple people or things.
back_cards.example_en: They have a common interest in music.
It’s a common mistake for beginners.
The park is for common use by all.
Rain is common in this region.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to give a negative response.
back_cards.example_en: No, I can’t come to the party.
She said no to the extra work.
There’s no milk left in the fridge.
No, that’s not what happened!
No smoking is allowed in this area.
The exam was hard for most students.

back_cards.definition_en: Firm or solid to the touch.
back_cards.example_en: The ground was hard after the frost.
She has a hard job at the factory.
He’s a hard negotiator in business.
The team faced hard criticism after the loss.
She sent a message to her friend.
The movie’s message was about hope.
He received a message on his phone.
The teacher left a message on the board.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of information to convey.
back_cards.example_en: The speech carried an important message.
She sang a beautiful song at the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of music for singing.
back_cards.example_en: The choir practiced a new song.
The morning was filled with birds’ songs.

back_cards.definition_en: A short poem set to music.
back_cards.example_en: The folk song told a historical story.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of emotion through music.
back_cards.example_en: Her song expressed deep sadness.
I enjoy reading books on weekends.
They enjoyed the party last night.
She enjoys the taste of spicy food.
We enjoyed the beautiful sunset at the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To make use of something pleasantly.
back_cards.example_en: He enjoys his new job at the museum.
Their houses are similar in design.
The two paintings are similar in style.
Her experience is similar to mine.
The taste is similar to fresh mint.
They have similar goals for the project.
Congress passed a new law this year.
The medical congress discussed new treatments.
The congress of leaders was productive.
Congress debated the budget for hours.
The science congress attracted many experts.
The attack on the village was unexpected.
He suffered a heart attack last night.
Her speech was an attack on corruption.
The team planned a strong attack in soccer.
The cyber attack targeted the company’s data.
The past taught us valuable lessons.
She rarely talks about her past.
The museum displays relics from the past.
In the past, people traveled by horse.

back_cards.definition_en: A time before the present moment.
back_cards.example_en: The past year was full of challenges.
The soup is too hot to eat now.
He loves hot chili with his meals.
That new song is really hot right now.
The debate was a hot topic at work.
The police followed a hot lead in the case.

back_cards.definition_en: To look for or try to find.
back_cards.example_en: She went to the library to seek information.
He seeks a career in engineering.
They seek advice from their mentor.

back_cards.definition_en: To try to achieve or obtain.
back_cards.example_en: The company seeks to expand its market.
The hikers seek a safe path up the mountain.
The recipe needs a small amount of sugar.
The amount owed was $100.
A large amount of work was completed.

back_cards.definition_en: A degree or level of something.
back_cards.example_en: The amount of effort she put in was impressive.
The amount of rainfall this month was high.
The analysis of the data took hours.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of components or structure.
back_cards.example_en: Her analysis of the book was insightful.
The lab conducted an analysis of the sample.
His analysis of the game was spot-on.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of breaking down information.
back_cards.example_en: The report included an analysis of sales trends.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where goods are sold.
back_cards.example_en: She bought milk at the grocery store.

back_cards.definition_en: A supply or stock of something.
back_cards.example_en: The store of food lasted through winter.
The tools are kept in the store room.
The new store opened downtown.
He downloaded a game from the app store.
The army built a strong defense system.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of defending in sports.
back_cards.example_en: The team’s defense stopped the goal.
The lawyer presented a solid defense in court.
The country increased its defense budget.
Her defense of the plan was convincing.
The restaurant gave us the bill after dinner.
Congress voted on the new bill.
He paid with a twenty-dollar bill.

back_cards.definition_en: A list or account of items.
back_cards.example_en: The bill of sale included the car’s details.
The concert bill was posted around town.
I like to listen to music in the evening.
She likes her coffee with sugar.
He likes the idea of working from home.
They like each other and are good friends.
It feels like summer with this warm weather.
The scientist studied the cell under a microscope.
The prisoner was held in a small cell.
The solar cell powered the small device.
She entered data into the cell of the table.
He left his cell on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: At a distance from a place.
back_cards.example_en: She moved away from the noisy city.
He threw the old papers away.
The manager is away on a business trip.
The wind blew the leaves away.
She worked away on her project all day.
Her performance in the play was amazing.
The car’s performance improved after repairs.
The band’s performance drew a huge crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: The execution of a task or duty.
back_cards.example_en: His performance at work earned a promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: A display of skill or ability.
back_cards.example_en: The athlete’s performance broke a record.
She visited the hospital for a checkup.
The new hospital has advanced equipment.
The hospital staff worked tirelessly.
He was rushed to the hospital after the accident.
The hospital is studying new treatments.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of furniture for sleeping.
back_cards.example_en: She made the bed with fresh sheets.

back_cards.definition_en: The bottom of a river or sea.
back_cards.example_en: The river bed was covered in rocks.
He planted flowers in the garden bed.

back_cards.definition_en: A base or foundation for something.
back_cards.example_en: The machine rests on a concrete bed.

back_cards.definition_en: A place to rest or sleep.
back_cards.example_en: The dog curled up in its bed.

back_cards.definition_en: A flat piece of wood or material.
back_cards.example_en: He nailed the board to the fence.
The board approved the new budget.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface for notices or display.
back_cards.example_en: The schedule was posted on the board.

back_cards.definition_en: A table for food or meals.
back_cards.example_en: The restaurant offered room and board.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin, flat piece for a game.
back_cards.example_en: They played chess on a wooden board.
She wore sunscreen to protect her skin.
The police protect the community.
They work to protect the forest.
The case protects the phone from drops.
The lawyer fought to protect her client.
The building is from the 19th century.
The century saw many technological advances.
He scored a century in the cricket match.
A century of roses bloomed in the garden.
The new century brought hope for peace.

back_cards.definition_en: The warmest season of the year.
back_cards.example_en: We went swimming every day last summer.

back_cards.definition_en: A time of warmth or growth.
back_cards.example_en: The flowers bloomed in the summer.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of vacation or rest.
back_cards.example_en: The kids enjoyed their summer break.
Summer is perfect for hiking and camping.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for youth or peak.
back_cards.example_en: In the summer of her life, she traveled.

back_cards.definition_en: The substance something is made of.
back_cards.example_en: The chair is made of wooden material.
She gathered material for her art project.
The book provided material for the report.
The dress was made of soft material.

back_cards.definition_en: Items or supplies for a task.
back_cards.example_en: The construction site needed more material.
Each individual has unique talents.
She’s a creative individual with bold ideas.
Every individual in the team contributed.
The survey asked for individual opinions.
The study focused on each individual case.

back_cards.definition_en: Not long ago or in the near past.
back_cards.example_en: She recently moved to a new city.
The store was recently renovated.
He recently finished writing a book.
Recently, more people use online banking.
They recently announced a new project.

back_cards.definition_en: A sample to show how something works.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher gave an example of the math problem.

back_cards.definition_en: A model to follow or imitate.
back_cards.example_en: She is an example of a great leader.

back_cards.definition_en: A case that illustrates a point.
back_cards.example_en: This painting is an example of modern art.
The lion is an example of a wild animal.
His success is an example for young athletes.

back_cards.definition_en: To act or speak for someone.
back_cards.example_en: She was chosen to represent her team.
The dove represents peace in many cultures.
The painting represents a stormy sea.

back_cards.definition_en: To be an example of something.
back_cards.example_en: These students represent the school’s best.
The lawyer will represent the case in court.
She filled the glass with water.
The crowd filled the stadium.
He filled out the job application.

back_cards.definition_en: To satisfy a need or requirement.
back_cards.example_en: The meal filled our hunger.

back_cards.definition_en: To take up a role or position.
back_cards.example_en: She filled the role of team leader.
The house was in a bad state.
She lives in the state of California.
The state passed a new education law.

back_cards.definition_en: A mode of being or existence.
back_cards.example_en: His state of mind was calm.
The president gave a state address.
The park is a nice place to relax.
She found a place to sit in the café.
He took his place as team captain.
Their place is cozy and welcoming.
She finished in first place in the race.
The zoo has many animals, like lions.
She loves her pet animal, a dog.
The animal was observed in its habitat.
The forest is home to many animals.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for wild or domestic creatures.
back_cards.example_en: Farm animals include cows and chickens.
She failed the test despite studying.
The engine failed during the trip.
The project failed to attract investors.

back_cards.definition_en: To neglect or miss a duty.
back_cards.example_en: He failed to submit the report on time.
Her health began to fail last year.
Weather was a factor in the event’s success.
Cost is a key factor in the decision.
The number 5 is a factor of 20.
The study considered several factors.
Hard work was a factor in her promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to nature or the environment.
back_cards.example_en: The park is full of natural beauty.
She has a natural talent for singing.
The juice is made from natural ingredients.
It’s natural to feel nervous before a speech.
His natural charm won everyone over.

back_cards.definition_en: A polite address for a man.
back_cards.example_en: Excuse me, sir, can you help me?
The waiter replied, ‘Yes, sir!’

back_cards.definition_en: A title for a knighted man.
back_cards.example_en: Sir John was honored for his service.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to show courtesy in formal settings.
back_cards.example_en: Sir, your order is ready.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to address authority figures.
back_cards.example_en: The soldier saluted and said, ‘Sir!’

back_cards.definition_en: A business or organization providing services.
back_cards.example_en: The travel agency booked our trip.
The environmental agency monitors pollution.
She showed great agency in her decisions.

back_cards.definition_en: A group acting on behalf of others.
back_cards.example_en: The agency represented the actor.
Education gives people agency to improve lives.

back_cards.definition_en: Most of the time or typically.
back_cards.example_en: She usually wakes up at 7 a.m.
The store is usually open until 9 p.m.
He usually takes the bus to work.
They usually spend Sundays with family.
It usually rains in the afternoon.
Her speech had a significant impact.
There was a significant increase in sales.
The discovery was significant for science.
The gift was significant to her family.
The project required a significant effort.
She helped her friend with homework.
Drinking water can help your health.
He helped organize the charity event.
The map helped us find the location.
The waiter helped us with the menu.
Her ability to sing amazed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: The capacity to perform a task.
back_cards.example_en: He has the ability to solve problems.
Writing is one of her many abilities.
His ability to focus led to success.
The job requires the ability to lift heavy items.
The town is five miles away.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of length in races.
back_cards.example_en: She ran a mile in under six minutes.
His house is miles from the city.
The car gets 30 miles per gallon.
Her skills are miles ahead of others.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal expression of fact or opinion.
back_cards.example_en: The company issued a statement about the merger.
Her statement clarified the situation.
The bank sent a monthly statement.
His speech was a bold statement of goals.
The police took her statement after the incident.
She read the entire book in one day.
The entire team attended the meeting.
He spent his entire savings on the trip.
The entire project was a success.
The entire forest was covered in snow.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the Democratic Party.
back_cards.example_en: The democrat won the election.
She’s a democrat who values free elections.
As a democrat, he supports fair policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A politician in a democratic system.
back_cards.example_en: The democrat spoke about healthcare reform.
Democrats gathered to discuss governance.
The wooden floor was polished and shiny.
Her office is on the third floor.
Leaves covered the forest floor.

back_cards.definition_en: A platform for debate or discussion.
back_cards.example_en: He took the floor to share his ideas.
The stock price hit the floor.
The injury was serious and needed surgery.
She had a serious expression during the meeting.
The storm caused serious damage to the town.
He’s a serious student who studies daily.
Ignoring the warning could have serious consequences.
She built a successful career in law.
His career in teaching spanned 30 years.
The promotion boosted her career.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of work or expertise.
back_cards.example_en: He chose a career in technology.
Her career began as an intern.
The book costs ten dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of money in some countries.
back_cards.example_en: He exchanged euros for dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of value or price.
back_cards.example_en: The company is worth a billion dollars.
She found a dollar in her pocket.
The deal earned him millions of dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal choice in an election.
back_cards.example_en: She cast her vote for the new mayor.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of expressing a preference.
back_cards.example_en: The vote decided the club’s president.

back_cards.definition_en: The result of a group decision.
back_cards.example_en: The vote was unanimous for the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: A right to participate in decisions.
back_cards.example_en: Every citizen has a vote in the election.

back_cards.definition_en: A tally of opinions or choices.
back_cards.example_en: The vote showed strong support for change.

back_cards.definition_en: The biological distinction between male and female.
back_cards.example_en: The form asked for her sex: male or female.
The movie contained scenes of sex.
The study compared health trends by sex.
The biologist studied the sex of the fish.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic of discussion or interest.
back_cards.example_en: The book explores the history of sex education.

back_cards.definition_en: To examine for similarities or differences.
back_cards.example_en: She compared the two phones before buying.

back_cards.definition_en: To liken one thing to another.
back_cards.example_en: He compared the sunset to a painting.
The teacher compared their test scores.
This car doesn’t compare to the older model.
They compared prices at different stores.
